newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TRACTEBEL FREE-FLOAT TO SURGE ON POWERFIN MERGER.
newsitem.headline: TRACTEBEL FREE-FLOAT TO SURGE ON POWERFIN MERGER.

text.p: The number of free-floating shares in utility holding company Tractebel SA will rise by about 64 percent after the merger with unit Powerfin, Tractebel said in the prospectus for the operation.
Shareholders of both companies approved the merger at extraordinary shareholders' meetings on Thursday.
"Some international investors had said that Tractebel's free float was insufficient. This operation will remedy that problem," Tractebel chief executive officer Philippe Bodson told shareholders.

Tractebel, which currently owns 62.22 percent of Powerfin, will issue 3.02 million new shares (21.5 percent of the existing number of shares), which will be exchanged at a one-for-three ratio for Powerfin shares it does not yet own.

The operation will reduce the Tractebel stake of Belgian holding company Societe Generale de Belgique SA (SGB) and related companies from the current 65.61 percent to 54.25 percent (50.27 percent for SGB alone).
The free-float, currently at an estimated 4.8 million shares (35 percent of total number of shares), will rise to 7.8 million shares (46 percent of the total) after the merger.
Tractebel shares will be split five-for-one to make the share more accessible for small investors, Bodson said.
The operation will be finalised on October 10, when Powerfin shareholders will receive five Tractebel shares (after the split) for three Powerfin shares.
Powerfin shares will remain listed until the end of 1997 to allow Powerfin shareholders to bring the number of Powerfin shares in their portfolio to a multiple of three.
The merger will boost Tractebel's stock market capitalisation to about 255 billion francs from 210 billion.
